lead_paragraph: After the swift conquest of Poland, Norway, the Netherlands, Belgium and France many people began to assume that Germany had somehow changed the fundamental laws of warfare. They believed that because of the application of the gas engine to military uses in the air and on the ground, the great conflict would be won or lost solely in terms of German "Blitz."
